statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE survey_id = 1;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, engagement_data FROM EmployeeSurveys ORDER BY survey_id DESC;
SELECT employee_id, satisfaction_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE employee_id = 100 ORDER BY satisfaction_rating DESC;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, satisfaction_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE satisfaction_rating < 3;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE satisfaction_rating BETWEEN 2 AND 4 AND engagement_data->'overall_engagement' = 'high';
SELECT survey_id, satisfaction_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE employee_id = 200;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, engagement_data->'team_engagement' AS team_engagement FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE employee_id = 300;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE employment_status = 'Full-time';
SELECT * FROM employee_surveys WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3 AND engagement_rating > 3;
SELECT last_name, first_name, department FROM employees ORDER BY department, last_name ASC;
SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'Marketing' AND employment_status = 'Part-time';
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name FROM employees WHERE emp_id > 100 ORDER BY last_name DESC;
SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, department FROM employees WHERE employment_status = 'Full-time' ORDER BY first_name ASC, last_name ASC;
SELECT emp_id, first_name, last_name, department FROM employees WHERE department IN ('Sales', 'Marketing') AND employment_status = 'Part-time';

SELECT e.emp_id, e.first_name, e.last_name, es.satisfaction_rating, es.engagement_rating FROM employees e INNER JOIN employee_surveys es ON e.emp_id = es.emp_id WHERE e.department = 'HR' AND es.engagement_rating > 3 ORDER BY es.satisfaction_rating DESC;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys ORDER BY survey_date DESC;
SELECT employee_id, survey_date, engagement_score FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE employee_id = 101;
SELECT survey_id, employee_id, satisfaction_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys WHERE satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM SatisfactionRatings WHERE rating_value BETWEEN 2 AND 4;
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(survey_id) AS survey_count FROM EngagementData GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(survey_id) > 1;
SELECT * FROM EmployeeSurveys ORDER BY survey_date DESC, satisfaction_rating ASC LIMIT 10;
SELECT employee_id, AVG(satisfaction_rating) as avg_rating FROM EmployeeSurveys GROUP BY employee_id HAVING avg_rating > 4.5;

SELECT es.survey_id, er.rating_value, ed.feedback FROM EmployeeSurveys es JOIN SatisfactionRatings er ON es.survey_id = er.survey_id JOIN EngagementData ed ON es.survey_id = ed.survey_id WHERE er.rating_value >= 3 AND ed.feedback IS NOT NULL;

SELECT es.survey_id, er.rating_value, ed.feedback FROM EmployeeSurveys es LEFT JOIN SatisfactionRatings er ON es.survey_id = er.survey_id LEFT JOIN EngagementData ed ON es.survey_id = ed.survey_id WHERE er.rating_value IS NULL OR ed.feedback IS NULL;
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(DISTINCT survey_id) as num_surveys FROM EmployeeSurveys GROUP BY employee_id HAVING num_surveys > 2;
SELECT * FROM Employee;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employee ORDER BY department ASC;
SELECT * FROM Survey WHERE survey_date >= '2022-01-01';
SELECT e.employee_name, r.satisfaction_rating, r.engagement_rating FROM Employee e INNER JOIN Rating r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id;
SELECT a.survey_id, a.total_responses, a.average_satisfaction_rating, s.survey_name FROM Analysis a INNER JOIN Survey s ON a.survey_id = s.survey_id ORDER BY a.total_responses DESC;
SELECT * FROM Employee WHERE department = 'Sales';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employee WHERE hire_date > '2021-01-01';
SELECT employee_name, department FROM Employee ORDER BY employee_id DESC;
SELECT survey_name, survey_date FROM Survey WHERE survey_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31';
SELECT e.employee_name, r.satisfaction_rating FROM Employee e JOIN Rating r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id WHERE r.satisfaction_rating > 3;
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT'
SELECT * FROM surveys ORDER BY date_conducted DESC
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(response_id) FROM responses GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(response_id) > 5
SELECT survey_name, total_questions FROM surveys WHERE total_questions > 10 AND date_conducted BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30'
SELECT employee_id, MAX(rating_value) AS max_rating FROM ratings GROUP BY employee_id ORDER BY max_rating DESC
SELECT first_name, last_name, department FROM employees ORDER BY department DESC, first_name ASC
SELECT survey_name, date_conducted, total_questions FROM surveys WHERE total_questions > 10 ORDER BY date_conducted DESC
SELECT survey_id, COUNT(response_id) AS total_responses FROM responses GROUP BY survey_id HAVING total_responses > 5
SELECT employee_id, survey_id, rating_value FROM ratings WHERE rating_value BETWEEN 3 AND 5 ORDER BY employee_id, survey_id
SELECT e.first_name, e.last_name, r.rating_value, r.comment FROM employees e JOIN ratings r ON e.employee_id = r.employee_id
